website_summaries.verdict: A great learning machine and good for simple projects, but machine can't handle more complex tasks.
pros: Wonderful machine for kids learning to knit, and the price is great
cons: Once you start getting into more complex projects, the machine tends to jump stitches and generally misbehaves

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this machine. Thought it would be great. My 3rd one and this is worse then the other 2 I threw away. You can do 2 rows of any yarn than it father's up drops stitches oh ya my kind of fun. This thing is worth maybe 1.50 The Yarn I'm trying to undo as you see it's a piece of s... I would NEVER buy or recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: happy

customer_reviews.title: Using this for dying yarn. Its ok.
customer_reviews.text: I am using this machine to wind up yarn for dying. It does work, but a few of the hooks pull a bit of yarn giving a hole. Also sometimes the yarn doesn't want to fall off the hook and gets piled up. Being that it's plastic sometimes I feel like I'll end up breaking it. Overall it's a good item.
customer_reviews.author: kittenmallow

customer_reviews.title: Works great with thinner yarn
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my granddaughter for Christmas. She immediately started making knitted accessories. I got her one last year, but it broke, because we used yarn that was too thick. Works great with thinner yarn!
customer_reviews.author: L. McManus

customer_reviews.title: Knitting Machine
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the knitting machine for a Christmas gift for my granddaughter as the item was out of stock in Canada. She is really enjoying the machine - she does need some supervision from her Mom but she really enjoys the item. Good value for a great learning tool.
customer_reviews.author: Alanamarie Procyk

customer_reviews.title: love it. this has 2 less needles than the ...
customer_reviews.text: love it. this has 2 less needles than the singer and star weaver. great for smaller projects!
customer_reviews.author: LMHS

customer_reviews.title: The Route I took to get this machine
customer_reviews.text: It was something that my granddaughter wanted, the only store carring it was Sears in Canada, but couldn't get it. So I went to Amazon and although I had to have it sent to my friends address in San Diego cause to come to Canada it was almost 3 times the cost of the product, itself, we meant in Maui, Hawaii and I brought it home with me and my Granddaughter loved it. So I everyone was happy all around. Thank you Amazon,.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Dube

customer_reviews.title: It is just a toy.
customer_reviews.text: It worked good for a little bit. I was able to make one pair of socks then the machine locked up. I even took it apart and put it back together. It is now a useless hunk of plastic sitting on my table. I guess it is just a toy afterall.
customer_reviews.author: Tally

customer_reviews.title: My granddaughter is excited to use it but we are ...
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter is excited to use it but we are trying to figure how the yarn holds. We wont give up on it we will get it going.
customer_reviews.author: goosie

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Should have believed the reviews...a complete waste of time and money. Constantly drops stitches no matter what weight of yarn is used. Not even a good paperweight! Nicely packaged and very fast shipping, but the machine is a turd.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hereford

customer_reviews.title: great item
customer_reviews.text: A very good item for people like me who want to knit but can't for physical reasons. My hands can't hold a needle long enough. Also good for kids. Works good also.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Not for serious knitters, because it is a "toy".
customer_reviews.text: I was glad I didn't have to pay $62.00 for this, and I'm not so sure it's really worth even $28.00. I've tried several times to make something with this machine. Unfortunately you have to keep a close eye on each hook while knitting, because the yarn will sometimes skip a stitch leaving a hole in your project. I've been trying to make sure I follow all the directions exactly, as they explain how to use the knitting machine, and it still skips stitches even when it looks like the yarn has been hooked. So, I'm not 100% a fan of this machine, but it might be great for kids just learning about knitting.
customer_reviews.author: LSL308

customer_reviews.title: We are a little disappointed in this
customer_reviews.text: I remembered playing with one of these when i was a kid. I was thrilled when my daughter saw one and wanted it. It works well with the tube setting, but does not always stop for the flat panel. We are a little disappointed in this, but she still loves making the tubes.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Sechler

customer_reviews.title: gift
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my 12 year old granddaughter, and she love's it. She couldn't wait to get it out of the box and get started on making a scarf.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Cute for the girls
customer_reviews.text: My daughter have enjoyed making the tube socks and she's working on making a scarf now. the thread sometimes doesn't weave tightly together sometimes, but all in all its fun for the girls.
customer_reviews.author: B. Lipscomb

customer_reviews.title: Granddaughter age 11 loved it and it must be easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Granddaughter age 11 loved it and it must be easy to use, as she had made everyone something. Good price on Amazon
customer_reviews.author: DinKansas

customer_reviews.title: Lori
customer_reviews.text: hard for little fingers to work, but with a little help my granddaughter was able to work it and she made some arm warmers
customer_reviews.author: Lori Alice

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to keep yarn on the hook and yarn pops ...
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to keep yarn on the hook and yarn pops off every few stitches. Haven't completed one single thing with it. :(
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: NSI NVG
customer_reviews.text: Suggested use by "6 year olds and up" but found very difficult to thread even by 10 year old. Also it made slipped stitches. Sorry it's just not very good.
customer_reviews.author: Lungtaworld

customer_reviews.title: fantastic
customer_reviews.text: fantastic. Gift to my 7 year old grandaughter which, with some help, knitts beautiful scarfs!!
customer_reviews.author: Jose Eduardo O. Lima

customer_reviews.title: It's OK
customer_reviews.text: I tried this product out for size prior to giving it to my niece for Xmas. It does not, but not too sure I like the cast on - loose and flimsy. I'll need to help her with it. Will have a better rating later.
customer_reviews.author: Bombolini

customer_reviews.title: disappointed in the purchase
customer_reviews.text: impossible for a youngster and her grandma; disappointed in the purchase, do not buy
customer_reviews.author: C. Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This product is the best knitting machine I have ever bought for a child. It is sturdy and can use real yarn and not the cheap flimsy stuff. My Niece LOVED it. she can't stop making things and her comment was I would do this all day if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Skips stitches no matter what kind of yarn I used.
customer_reviews.author: kenny jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time, creative jucies.
customer_reviews.text: Carriage was jammed when received. Just not impressed at all, poor investment.
customer_reviews.author: Hope Exline

customer_reviews.title: Not really a toy
customer_reviews.text: I cannot imagine a child operating this independently. Some adult oversight and assistance is required. I bought this to make knitting blanks for gradient dyeing. The knitting machine knits tubes easily and without dropped stitches. However, my first attempt at a flat panel was a disaster with dropped stitches galore. I frogged that one and have yet to try again.
customer_reviews.author: yarngirl1952

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap and breaks quickly
customer_reviews.text: Got to go se it three times before it broke. It's very cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Quality not good
customer_reviews.text: did not last long broke in less than a month.
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: You really need patience. It does drop stitches quite ...
customer_reviews.text: You really need patience. It does drop stitches quite frequently. The most disappointing thing is the yarn in the box was a mess. My daughter-in-law spent hours straightening out the yarn, a child would not have been able to do it.
customer_reviews.author: Carol S

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: The beginning does not come out correctly....... leaves lots of unattached areas. The ending is difficult as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Hearne

customer_reviews.title: It's awfully difficult to make go...
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old daughter can't run it on her own. So I tried helping... And after much struggling, we knit about 3 inches of tube. It kept skipping and jamming. I would give it 1 star, but... Other people seem to have some success with it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C

customer_reviews.title: Great Machine
customer_reviews.text: Bought machine for 8 year old grandchild. She made a hat within one hour of opening it. Works great and she loves it
customer_reviews.author: Dahl F. Hallman

customer_reviews.title: It is way to small. The description should state ...
customer_reviews.text: It is way to small. The description should state that you can make baby items. The diameter is so small to fit pets or infants bodies.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Not the best , by hand is best
customer_reviews.text: Not the best I do not think my daughter has got a complete project, yet. Very touching and you have to watch it closely and go slowly.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: It did a fine job. As long as the yarn was loose
customer_reviews.text: It did a fine job. As long as the yarn was loose, there wasn't any clicking noise. My 6 year old and I made a scarf in about 40 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Creative and nifty
customer_reviews.text: you must choose the wool that your are using for this item very wisely. maybe a cotton type. Have made just a small try at the moment, and I think a person has to persevere, but i think its a fun toy
customer_reviews.author: irene bruce

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Very chip quality. I had to pay $6.00 of shipping to return it! :(
customer_reviews.author: David Cordova

customer_reviews.title: you have to turn carefully or it will fall apart
customer_reviews.text: after a few hours of trying the 'needles' came loose and the handle did not turn anymore. had to open the whole thing to repair...but it got repaired.
customer_reviews.author: Pascal Hufkens

customer_reviews.title: Hangs UP
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my granddaughter. She couldn't figure out how to use it from the very complex instructions. She is 10 years old. I read the instructions and finally figured out how to get the thread started. It knitted fast, but kept missing a couple of loops and therefore messed the entire piece up. I tried again and it did the same thing. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Bethlee

customer_reviews.title: Not what I thought
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so that my daughter could make scarves for the homeless. I followed the directions, watched the video numerous times, but have yet to get a scarf made. We have tried several different yarns, but it continues to drop stitches and then you end up with a big hole in your piece. I'm not going to give up on it yet, but will look for one that is better made and larger.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: Having a horrible time with the machine it works for about 10 turns and then the handle turns but the needles do not go up-and-down. Don't know if it's my specific machine that means to be tossed or if it's just not worth the money .
customer_reviews.author: kathi

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic
customer_reviews.text: I understand that this is a toy and not professional quality. That said, I still expected the quality to be a little better. Between the cheap plastic mechanism, tangled yarn, and difficult instructions, my daughter, who was super excited to get this for Christmas, was quickly frustrated and gave up.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Fay

customer_reviews.title: practice knitting
customer_reviews.text: This product, is great. for a hand knitter your just amazed at how fast the fabric comes out. it is a toy, but its a great to practice with machine knitting. the only cons to the machine are: -the beginning isn't cast-off -the crack might slip if tension is too high -theres a click noise [click noise means your doing it right] -yarn is a little expensive [ light 3 yarn] - finishing both ends off is challenging . but you must remember this is a toy. a real knitting machine might run you 100$ and up i love my nsi knitting machine
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: gift to my grandaughter
customer_reviews.text: after 1 scarf it starting clicking and dropping stitches. not impressed! would not buy this again. teach them how to knit!!
customer_reviews.author: Helen

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Good value for the price I paid for the item. It is highly recommended for any child who is craftsy.
customer_reviews.author: Dineen R. Garon

customer_reviews.title: Cute, but Does it Work?
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter was excited that she got this . She has not tried to use it, yet. Rating is premature.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Rice

customer_reviews.title: Works somewhat
customer_reviews.text: This machine works very well in the circular mode. There is a straight knitting mode that does not perform well. It's ok for a couple of inches then starts to unravel the stitches. My grandchildren really wanted to use it to knit scarves that were flat. Even I could'nt do it.
customer_reviews.author: rosie b

customer_reviews.title: Difficult for a six year old
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter loved it but I am the one trying to figure out how to work it. Still have not succeeded.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Novak

customer_reviews.title: its kind of flimsy but she can use it and makes things easily.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves it. I wish it was a little more stable, its kind of flimsy but she can use it and makes things easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It does not work properly
customer_reviews.text: The machine does not work properly. Expensive toy that does not work. I do not recommend this machine, skips stitches.
customer_reviews.author: P. Powers

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 2 projects.
customer_reviews.text: The first 2 projects were fine on this machine, after that, it skips stitches and leaves a giant hole in the work. Bah....
customer_reviews.author: K.

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: It is nice and the instructions are good but sometimes it does not go in the hook properly so it becomes harder.
customer_reviews.author: MUMTAZ A KHAN

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this NSI Knitting Machine for my daughter. We opened it, read the directions, and watched YouTube videos about this product. Within 15minutes it was broken! I followed directions!!! my daughter cried herself to sleep. I knit and own a knitting machine, so she wanted one of her own. What a disappointment. Very cheap!
customer_reviews.author: Alyce

customer_reviews.title: Not User Friendly
customer_reviews.text: Too much trouble for a little girl of 9 years of age! The yarn was all wound up and it took over an hour to get it straightened out.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Dandy little machine
customer_reviews.text: I liked this gadget. The one I ordered was incomplete (probably due to a damaged box), so I wasn't able to keep it, but I think I'd have enjoyed it had I been able to keep it.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca of SunnyBrook

customer_reviews.title: Be sure this is suitable for child's abilities.
customer_reviews.text: Was not age appropriate for the child for whom it was intended. Too complicated. It should be better described in the item description.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald T. Hummel

customer_reviews.title: NSI Knitting Machine
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointment in this. The machine would not go around once without dropping stitches. A young child would have become frustrated very fast. I would not recommend anyone to purchase this. I feel I wasted my money on it.
customer_reviews.author: Sally S.

customer_reviews.title: Disapppointing
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed the way it works. I need to do it so slow so the thread will work together. I was planning to return it but I threw the box already. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Mercedes V Celestial

customer_reviews.title: not good
customer_reviews.text: product broke in first 10 minutes. called NSI customer service {no one available}. Call returned next day, told replacement part would be sent. That was 3 weeks ago and no part sent. Called yesterday - [no one available]. No return call yet. Tomorrow product will be returned to Amazon for refund. I'm done with this product.
customer_reviews.author: lab

customer_reviews.title: Returned this item
customer_reviews.text: I gave this 1 star because I bought as a gift and it was a duplicate and I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Joann L. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: My daughter just started playing with her new gift and really likes it. The only reason I don't give it 5 stars is because sometimes she forgets which way she is turning it and starts to turn it the other way and then the yarn comes off the hooks.
customer_reviews.author: sparky

product_meta.title: NSI Knitting Machine
product_meta.description:
Turn the crank to swiftly knit your own clothes! With the Imagine Nation® Knitting Machine, knitting is a snap. In no time you can knit your very own scarf, hat or even a sweater!

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Turn the crank to swiftly knit your own clothes. This is not a professional machine, acrylic, sport weight yarn will generally give the best results.
feature_bullets: Set includes knitting machine, safe sewing needle and 2 skeins of thread
Stay warm this winter knitting your clothes with your own knitting machine

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.1 out of 5 stars95 ratings3.1 out of 5 stars
